query: You are a patent examiner. Please write a summary of this patent.
gt: The invention provides a method and system for cleaning pet paws providing a bounded container containing a plurality of soft scrub brushes defining a paw cleaning region within an outer container wall wherein cleaning solution can flow freely within the container between a paw-for-cleaning, the container wall, and the brushes while allowing space for sediment. A spill resistant lid allows easy transport. An optional splash resistant lid containing a further brush boundary enables an enhanced side leg cleaning. The proposed method and system enables an enhanced deep cleaning through repeated submersion within the container and removable of debris. The system aids in prevention of infection and disease.
retrieval-bm25-turbo-0613_pred: The present invention relates to a method and system for cleaning pet paws or other animal appendages. The system includes a container with soft scrub brushes for cleaning the paws and a sealing, spill-resistant lid for easy transport and containment of cleaning solution or debris. The system allows for the reduction or elimination of the transmission of bacteria, parasites, and other contaminants into homes or vehicles. The patent also describes various alternative embodiments, such as a splash-resistant lid for enhanced limb or leg cleaning, and the use of flow-through brushes for cleaning a range of animals. The invention provides an improved method and system for cleaning and sterilizing pet paws.

query: You are a patent examiner. Please write a summary of this patent.
gt: The invention comprises a process for preparing oatmeal, which process comprises soaking steel cut oats and oat bran for a period of time sufficient to hydrate the oats, mixing rolled oats into the hydrated oat fraction, cooking the resultant mixture for a period of time sufficient to produce a flavorful food product, and optionally aseptically packaging the resulting product. The invention also comprises a process for preparing an oatmeal composition, which process comprises cooking steel cut oats in a manner so that the material is hydrated, adding rolled oats after a cooking time such that cooking of steel cut oats is substantially complete, adding optionally hydrated oat bran either before or after addition of the rolled oats, cooking the entire mixture for a time sufficient to render the product edible and packaging the product. The packaging steps in this aspect of the invention may comprise adding an acidic modifier to the cookable oat mixture, filling containers with the cooked oat mixture, inverting the filled containers allowing hot air to rise through the containers, and cooling the oatmeal. Alternatively, the packaging steps may comprise transferring the product to containers and cooling the product and container to a temperature sufficiently low so as to maintain product freshness and to retard spoilage.
retrieval-bm25-turbo-0613_pred: This patent describes an invention related to a complete oatmeal food product that can be prepared without the addition of water or other ingredients. The invention addresses the challenge of packaging oatmeal in a water-containing form without negatively impacting the flavor and texture of the final product. The process described involves soaking steel cut oats and oat bran to form a hydrated oat mixture, adding rolled oats to the mixture, heating it to cook the oatmeal, and optionally aseptically packaging the cooked oat mixture. In an alternative process, the oatmeal preparation can be carried out in a retort apparatus. The patent also provides details on the specific steps and conditions involved in the preparation. The resulting oatmeal product has a pleasing texture and can be stored in prepackaged form for long periods of time. It can be heated using microwave cooking. The patent includes specific examples to illustrate the invention's application. Overall, this invention provides a convenient oatmeal food product that retains its quality and can be easily prepared by consumers.

query: You are a patent examiner. Please write a summary of this patent.
gt: A log rolling apparatus includes a body having a depression or well positioned therein and a large sheet of canvas or similar flexible material positioned over the body and the well. The canvas is fixedly attached to respective ends of the body and a dual link pivotal member is provided to which is attached a roller movable between the body and the canvas. Sheets of flammable material and optionally other burnable material, such as leaves or the like, may be placed within the well over the top surface of the canvas, and the pivotal member may then be rotated about the body in a manner which causes the canvas to attempt to follow the roller attached to the member, thus causing the top surface of the canvas to slide against itself so as to roll up the flammable sheet material into a log shape with the leaves, if used, enclosed by the sheet material.
retrieval-bm25-turbo-0613_pred: The present patent describes a log rolling apparatus for manufacturing fire logs. The invention addresses the need for a device that can roll flammable materials that are not in sheet form, in addition to flammable sheets. The apparatus comprises a curvilinearly-shaped body member with a depression or well formed in it. A sheet of canvas or similar material is fixedly attached to the body member, covering the top curved surface and extending into the well. The apparatus also includes a multi-link construction of arms that are pivotable along the sides of the body member. A roller is fixedly secured between the arms, which allows for variable distance movement along the body member. Flammable materials can be placed in the well, along with flammable sheets, and the roller pulls the canvas away from the body member when the arms are pivoted. Overall, this log rolling apparatus allows for the rolling of various flammable materials into log shapes for easy burning.

query: You are a patent examiner. Please write a summary of this patent.
gt: A pet headgear comprises two halves operable in “clamshell” fashion to surround the head, nose and mouth of a pet, to facilitate handling of the pet in familiar or especially unfamiliar environments, such as veterinary offices, groomers, kennels or during transporting. The clamshell hinges at one end, preferably a caudal end, so it may be applied from behind the pet and the two halves biased medially to close the shell about the pet's head, prior to latching the halves closed. Openings may be provided for access to the pet's ears, nose, teeth, and/or mouth. A pleasant sensory zone (PSZ) or module may be added to quiet and appease the pet and habituate them to the headgear through positive reinforcement.
retrieval-bm25-turbo-0613_pred: The patent describes a muzzle or headgear for animals that is designed to reduce anxiety and stress. The headgear consists of two half clamshell portions connected by a flexible hinge joint, with a fastener mechanism to secure the portions together. It can be fitted onto the animal's head from a posterior direction. The clamshell portions are sized and shaped to closely fit the animal's head, with openings for the eyes and ears if necessary. The headgear may also include padding for comfort. Additionally, there is a pleasant sensory zone (PSZ) that delivers a pleasant stimulus to the animal while wearing the headgear, using features such as flavor ports, pheromones, or tactile stimulation.

query: You are a patent examiner. Please write a summary of this patent.
gt:
Pharmaceutical composition of skin respiratory factor (SRF), sodium chloride, bicarbonate, fluoride and zinc chloride in a suitable toothpaste vehicle provides effective therapy for gingivitis when brushed on the teeth and gingivae. 
     Pharmaceutical composition of SRF in a viscous composition suitable for application to the gingivae and effective over an extended period of time for healing tissue damaged by gingevitis. A toothpaste tube for packaging a pharmaceutical composition of SRF, sodium chloride, bicarbonate, fluoride and zinc chloride.
retrieval-bm25-turbo-0613_pred: This patent describes a pharmaceutical toothpaste composition for treating gingivitis. The composition contains skin respiratory factor (SRF), sodium chloride, bicarbonate, fluoride, and zinc ions in a toothpaste vehicle. The toothpaste is formulated with specific quantities of the active components and other ingredients such as polishing agents, thickening agents, sudsing agents, humectants, flavoring agents, and sweetening agents. The toothpaste is designed to reduce inflammation, bleeding, and swelling associated with gingivitis and promote healing of the gums.

query: You are a patent examiner. Please write a summary of this patent.
gt: Cornea marker apparatus and a method of corneal marking are provided for purposes of corrective surgery. The apparatus features a blade assembly having readily visible blade ends as well as a blade assembly concept with a radial guide allowing rotation of the blades to selected meridian alignments for precise marking of the surface of the cornea.
retrieval-bm25-turbo-0613_pred: This patent relates to an improved cornea marker apparatus used in eye surgery, specifically for corrective procedures like refractive keratotomy. The invention addresses the limitations of existing marker instruments by providing marker blades that are more visible and accurately aligned. The patent includes detailed descriptions and drawings of different embodiments of the cornea marker. Overall, the invention aims to improve the accuracy and reliability of marking the cornea for surgical procedures.

query: You are a patent examiner. Please write a summary of this patent.
gt: Novel suppository pharmaceutical formulations of the platinum antitumor agent, JM216, are provided. Such dosage forms provide an alternative to the oral form currently available and offer improved bioavailability of this promising drug.
retrieval-bm25-turbo-0613_pred: This patent discloses a method of increasing the solubility and bioavailability of a platinum antitumor complex, JM216, as well as a suppository formulation for rectal administration of JM216.

query: You are a patent examiner. Please write a summary of this patent.
gt: Dough with a high sucrose content (such as cake dough) tends to inhibit the activity of an anti-staling amylase such as Novamyl, making it less effective to prevent the staling of dough-based products with high sucrose content such as cakes. A good anti-staling effect in cakes can be achieved by using a carefully selected anti-staling amylase with certain properties.  Analysis of a 3D structure of Novamyl shows that sucrose may inhibit by binding in the active site. Sucrose docks into the active site of Novamyl differently from the substrate or inhibitor in published models 1QHO and 1QHP. This finding is used to design sucrose-tolerant variants.
retrieval-bm25-turbo-0613_pred: This patent application discloses the use of anti-staling amylases in the preparation of dough or dough-based edible products with a high sucrose content. The inventors have found that a high sucrose content inhibits the activity of anti-staling amylases, making them less effective in preventing the staling of dough-based products. The application describes a carefully selected anti-staling amylase with certain properties that show a good anti-staling effect in cakes. The patent also provides information on amino acid alterations to decrease sucrose inhibition and improve the performance of the amylase. Overall, the invention aims to improve the quality and shelf life of high-sucrose dough-based products.
